ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
This was a great class on acting. We read from authors such as Hagen, Tharp, Gillet, and Stanislavsky to learn about various teachings around acting and creativity.  We underwent some rehearsals, some acting exercises, some physicality exercises, some solo work, collaborative work, etc. 

I feel more adequately equipped to approach acting. I now have tools for approaching the script, the table work, the on-the-feet work, the rehearsal, and the fine tuning.

I thought I developed my acting and my technique.

It is very much a class where you get as much from it as you put in.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Hal is very patient, which can be very helpful or can be abused by some. We fell behind this semester because so many came to class unprepared and it set a precedent that dominated the pace. So, if other students aren't involved the class as a whole will be much less exciting.

A weakness of this course is that it does not take place in a theater/rehearsal space. We used two separate classrooms where we had to clear the chairs and tables. I think you can act anywhere, but I do think some spaces are more conducive to risk-taking and acting rehearsal, and these spaces were quite inconvenient.

Hal covers a lot of ground in this class and I'd honestly say that you can get a good sense for all the concepts despite the speed of it, but if you fall behind as we did it can be confusing.

It is a really good acting class and I have become a better actor from taking it.  However, it took up a lot more time than I anticipated since it is a lot of class time and you have to do a lot of prep work before class. I think it would have been better if we had more time in class to practice our work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: this class is solidly mid - if you're looking to take a theater class, there are definitely better ones you can take

I would. I was not a TAPS major and I took it anyway because I like Hal. 

If acting doesn't really interest you, it's probably best to not take it though.

You should be ready to put in the work outside of class time.
I recommend taking this class if you want to find techniques to land a role or just want to perform a little bit every once in a while for fun,
